Here are some simple questions that can be answered based on the provided passage about Prince Michael of Saxe-Weimar-Eisenach:

Q1: Who is Prince Michael of Saxe-Weimar-Eisenach?
A1: Prince Michael is the current head of the Grand Ducal House of Saxe-Weimar-Eisenach and the most senior agnate of the entire House of Wettin.

Q2: When was Prince Michael born?
A2: Prince Michael was born on 15 November 1946 in Bamberg, Bavaria.

Q3: Who are some of Prince Michael's godparents?
A3: Among his godparents were Queen Juliana of the Netherlands and the Grand Duchess Anastasia of Russia imposter, Anna Anderson, who was living with his aunt Princess Luise of Saxe-Meiningen.

Q4: What happened to Prince Michael's father?
A4: Prince Michael's father, Hereditary Grand Duke Charles Augustus of Saxe-Weimar-Eisenach, died on 14 October 1988.

Q5: How did Prince Michael inherit the leadership in the House of Saxe-Altenburg?
A5: In 2012, Prince Michael inherited the leadership in the House of Saxe-Altenburg as that line became extinct.

Q6: Does Prince Michael have any children?
A6: No, Prince Michael has no sons and his only daughter Leonie Mercedes Augusta Silva Elisabeth Margarethe of Saxe-Weimar-Eisenach is childless.

Q7: What are some of Prince Michael's honors and awards?
A7: Prince Michael has received the Memorial Medal of Tree of Peace, Special class with rubies, from Slovakia on May 12, 2022.

Q8: Can you name any of the nongovernmental organizations that Prince Michael is involved with?
A8: Yes, Prince Michael is involved with the non-governmental organization Servare et Manere.

Q1: What was Prince Hermann's original royal status before he was disinherited?
A1: He was a member of the House of Saxe-Weimar-Eisenach and was heir to his relative William Ernest, Grand Duke of Saxe-Weimar-Eisenach.

Q2: What was the reason behind Prince Hermann's disinheritance?
A2: He was disinherited due to his unsavory reputation and his inability to pay off his debts.

Q3: Who did Prince Hermann desire to marry before he was disinherited?
A3: Prince Hermann desired to marry Princess Marie Bonaparte, a great heiress.

Q4: How many times did Prince Hermann marry?
A4: Prince Hermann married twice. His first marriage was to Wanda Paola Lottero in 1909, and his second marriage was to Suzanne Aagot Midling in 1918.

Q5: What was the reason for Prince Hermann's second marriage?
A5: Prince Hermann married again in 1932 after his first marriage ended in divorce. His second marriage was to Isabel Neilson, daughter of a former British MP and actor.

Q6: How many children did Prince Hermann have?
A6: Prince Hermann had one surviving child with his second wife, Alexander Kyrill Graf von Ostheim, who died unmarried in 1943.
